Exaggerate: The claim of contributing KSh49 billion in taxes annually may be an exaggeration as the total import tax on both used and new cars averaged KSh47.3 billion in the last two financial years.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the Kenya Auto Bazaar Association did not have published tax figures and instead came up with an estimate based on the number of imports and the average duty.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the import taxes paid on 1,500 cc cars constitute the "average import taxes," which is disputed by a director at professional services firm PwC Kenya.
Exist alternative explanation: The lobby group's claim of paying KSh49 billion in import taxes may have an alternative explanation, such as including other types of taxes or fees in their calculation.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the total import tax on both used and new cars averaged KSh47.3 billion in the last two financial years, suggesting that the KSh49 billion figure is higher than the actual amount.
